reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located close to the main access points for the town, so easy to find, but in walking distance of the heart of the old town for sight-seeing and restaurants. Staff speak reasonable english and are very helpful. Our room was spacious and very comfortable, with a balcony and lovely views over the hills. A little tired and in need of refurbishment, but well looked after and very clean. At the time of our stay there were no other guests in the hotel, and it must have 60 rooms. This was not a problem except that it was eerilie quiet and they didn't bother putting out a breakfast buffet but just asked us what we wanted (which led to some strange breakfasts as a result of linguistic or cultural misunderstandings). We were told during our stay that they had problems with their credit card systems and we would have to pay by cash, suggesting they might be in financial difficulty - which wouldn't be surprising with all the new hotel and appartment developments on the other side of town. But while it is still there I would recommend Hotel Orphey as a very good place to stay and excellent value.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but strangely quiet

reviews.text: Situated in quiet part of old-town Bansko.. I had a spacious, comfortably furnished room with mountain view. Large bathroom spotlessly clean. Plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: Surprised after reading previous negative reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Management, Reception, Dining room & Bar staff very friendly and helpful (most of whom spoke good English and responded well at my attempts to speak Bulgarian!). Nice indoor pool area (I didn't use the spa or sauna facilities which were available). Excellent shuttle-bus service to Gondola station - necessary as its quite a distance to walk. Small on-site ski rental/storage facility.
reviews.title: Enjoyed
